Package tsi.too.io

Class BinaryFile<E>

java.lang.Object
tsi.too.io.BinaryFile<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of record.
public abstract class BinaryFile<E>
extends java.lang.Object
Provides operations for a binary file using the services of a file with random access. The definitions on this class are independent of the structure of a specific file. Therefore, the services can be used by any class that wants to use a structure and implement the services of a file with random access.

ATTENTION: The file structure in relation to the amount and types of data in the record is defined by the user of the class. However, the size of the records is required to be fixed. This restriction is fundamental for the correct functioning of the methods of the BinaryFile class.

Version:
0.36
Author:
Lucas Cristovam, Prof. MÃ¡rlon Oliveira da Silva

      Parameters:

    • seekRecord

      public void seekRecord​(long offset) throws java.io.IOException
      Position the file pointer at the position assigned by offset considering the record zero as the first record in the file.
      Parameters:
      offset - number corresponding to a record in the file.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if offset is less than 0 or if offset is greater than countRecords() or if an I/O error occurs.
      Since:
      0.36
